article.name: Westerfeld: Long-term field trial on tillage and fertilization in crop rotation

article.abstract: Agricultural long-term field trials provide fundamental data on crop performance and soil characteristics under diverse management practices. Here we present two decades of data (1992‑2023) from the Westerfeld long‑term field trial in Central Germany, comprising a strip‑split‑plot design that investigates the interactive effects of tillage (cultivator vs. plough), nitrogen‑fertilization intensity (intensive vs. extensive) and a five‑crop rotation (winter rapeseed, winter barley, winter wheat 1, grain maize, winter wheat 2). The dataset includes standardized measurements of soil physical and chemical properties, detailed crop management records, harvest yields and quality, root traits, plant biochemistry, gene expression, and meta‑barcode derived bacterial/archaeal and fungal community composition. The data are intended for meta‑analysis, modelling and AI approaches to improve understanding of how long‑term management shapes soil microbiomes and crop productivity.

funder.name: Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF), Germany
Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF), Germany

article.citation: Raab M, Schütz L, Sommermann L, Babin D, Kampouris I, Francioli D, Grosch R, Neumann G, Deubel A, Geistlinger J, Bade K, Rozhon W. Westerfeld: Long-term field trial on tillage and fertilization in crop rotation. Scientific Data. 2025;12:986. doi:10.1038/s41597-025-05314-z.

datasets.name: Westerfeld Long‑term Field Trial Dataset (BonaRes Repository)
datasets.description: Comprehensive data from the Westerfeld long‑term field trial (1992‑2023) in Bernburg, Central Germany. Includes experimental design, plot layout, soil physical‑chemical measurements, crop management records, harvest yields and quality, root morphology, plant biochemistry, gene expression, bacterial/archaeal and fungal community meta‑barcode data, and associated metadata.

spatialCoverage.description: Westerfeld field site, Bernburg (Saale), Saxony‑Anhalt, Germany

variableMeasured.name: Yield
variableMeasured.description: Grain yield expressed as decitonnes per hectare (dt ha⁻¹, 1 dt = 100 kg)

variableMeasured.name: Soil pH
variableMeasured.description: pH measured in 0.01 M CaCl₂ solution

variableMeasured.name: Micronutrients (Fe, Mn, Zn, Cu, B, Mg, Na)
Soil Moisture Content
variableMeasured.description: Gravimetric water content of soil samples

variableMeasured.name: Phytohormones (IAA, GA₃, CK, ABA, JA, SA)
variableMeasured.description: Concentrations of plant hormones in root tissue

variableMeasured.name: Enzyme Activities (APX, SOD)
variableMeasured.description: Activities of antioxidant enzymes in root tissue

variableMeasured.name: Bacterial/Archaeal Community Relative Abundance
variableMeasured.description: Taxonomic relative abundances from 16S rRNA meta‑barcode sequencing

variableMeasured.name: Fungal Community Relative Abundance
variableMeasured.description: Taxonomic relative abundances from ITS2 meta‑barcode sequencing

variableMeasured.name: Gene Expression (ΔΔCt values)
variableMeasured.description: Relative transcript abundances of selected stress‑related and nutrient‑transport genes

distribution.description: All tables provided as CSV files (experimental setup, field management, soil analysis, microbial communities, plant biochemistry, gene expression).

access.description: Dataset is openly available via the BonaRes Repository under the German Data License Attribution 2.0.

datasets.researchObjective: To quantify the long‑term effects of tillage practice (cultivator vs. plough), nitrogen‑fertilization intensity (intensive vs. extensive) and a five‑crop rotation on soil physicochemical properties, microbial community composition, root functional traits, plant biochemistry and crop yield, thereby providing a legacy dataset for meta‑analysis, ecosystem modelling and AI‑driven hypothesis generation aimed at sustainable agro‑ecosystem management.
